results.title: Kandinsky
results.brief_description: Working his way from totally familiar to abstract forms, Wassily Kandinsky changed the course of modern art in an exuberant mastery of colour. His Russian origin is stressed and his later turn towards the fine arts with a philosophic metaphysical outlook are emphasised.
results.description: Working his way from totally familiar to abstract forms, Wassily Kandinsky changed the course of modern art in an exuberant mastery of colour. His Russian origin is stressed and his later turn towards the fine arts with a philosophic metaphysical outlook are emphasised.
description_for_label: Working his way from totally familiar to abstract forms, Wassily Kandinsky changed the course of modern art in an exuberant mastery of colour. His Russian origin is stressed and his later turn towards the fine arts with a philosophic metaphysical outlook are emphasised.

results.title: Kanagawa: between sea and mountain
results.creator_credit: A Hidaka, T. Ogura and Asia Film
results.brief_description: Shows Kanagwawa prefecture on the rugged sea coast of Japan and the great national park. Trees provide the material for the many traditional and modern handcrafts of the area - objects d’art, lacquer, silk scarves, wood carving and decorative articles and screens made from sea shells. Reclaimed submerged trees are also used. By contrast, we see the great industrial complex of Yokohama city, a bustling harbour from which Japanese exports are shipped to every part of the world.

results.title: Just one kid
results.brief_description: An autobiographical look at the life of a Jewish boy growing up in London during the 1930’s providing a nostalgic impression of the Jewish community in London’s East End at that time. Highlights cultural traditions, continuity and change and the social conditions in the 30’s.

results.title: Just once
results.creator_credit: Anthony Perris and York Television Centre
results.brief_description: Considers the prevention of accidents to the eyes through wearing of safety lenses. Demonstrates the kind of accidents which can happen in industry. Shows the toughness of the lenses.

results.title: Jumpy, the grasshopper
results.brief_description: Jumpy tells a story about a grasshopper and other insects as a basis for language/arts activities, and to enrich the study of insects. Suitable for primary school level.

results.brief_description: Animated figures in a dream sequence introduce food nutrients, their function and their source. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Journey into time
results.brief_description: Presents an animated overview of the earth’s five great geological eras. Depicts one theory of the earth’s origin, its primeval state, transformation from a fiery ball to an inhabitable globe, and the predominant forms of life throughout geological time. Narrated by Gilbert Mack. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Journey back
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the rehabilitation of a hemiplegic patient. Deals with the cause and extent of paralysis and demonstrates the work of physical, occupational, recreational and speech therapists and their contribution to the recovery of the patient.

results.title: Conquering the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses new methods of exploiting the resources of the sea to be expected in the next century: fish farming and other means of food production, underwater mining and permanent residence for those employed, extraction of dissolved minerals, desalination for fresh water, and power generation.

results.title: The Remarkable school house
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Shows new teaching methods in use, particularly computer applications, and discusses the changes in schools to be expected in coming decades. Reporter Walter Cronkite.
